newsitem.title: USA: Chile set to become Mercosur associate member.
newsitem.headline: Chile set to become Mercosur associate member.

text.p: Chile will formally join Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay as an associate member of the Southern Cone free-trade bloc (Mercosur) as of October 1, the Chilean foreign minister said Monday.
"We're joining Mercosur as an associate member ... We're joining the free trade zone, not the entire common market," Jose Miguel Insulza told Reuters in New York.
In practical terms, Insulza said the Chilean government has made a commitment to to cut tariffs on about 70 percent of the goods traded between Chile and the four-nation group.

A 40 percent reduction of tariffs applying to those goods will take effect Tuesday. The cuts will affect mostly manufactured goods, agro-industrial products, copper and textiles, the Chilean official.
"The rest (of the tariffs cuts) will join later, and then in eight to 10 years we will have a free-trade zone, a completely free-trade zone," Insulza said.
The Chilean foreign minister said he expected the agreement would boost the country's annual trade with the other members of the Mercosur.
"We now have $4.0 billion (in trade), but we expect it grow," Insulza said, without saying by how much he expected it to expand.
"We also expect to close the $600 million (trade) gap we have with them (the Mercosur countries), which is mainly with Argentina," the minister said.
To be sure, the trade deficit was likely to widen before it narrowed, Insulza said.
"Now we're importing most of our oil from Argentina, and next year we'll have a gas pipeline ... and we're going to important most of our gas from Argentina," he said.
Insulza said he expected the Chilean economy to grow about 6.0 percent this year, down from 6.9 percent growth in gross domestic product in 1995.
"We had to put the brakes on the economy ... because of some problems of inflation," Insulza said.
The minister also forecast foreign direct investment in Chile this year at $2.5 billion, little changed from last year.
